name: Streptococcosis
cause: Bacterium Streptococcus iniae. Commonly transmitted through water or direct contact with infected fish.
cure: Administer antibiotics such as oxytetracycline or florfenicol. Improve water quality and reduce stress.

name: Parasitic Diseases
cause: Various parasitic organisms like protozoans, trematodes, and cestodes infecting fish, often through contaminated water.
cure: Use antiparasitic medications such as formalin or copper sulfate. Maintain proper water quality and hygiene.

name: Columnaris Disease
cause: Bacterium Flavobacterium columnare. This bacterium thrives in warm water, particularly under stressful conditions.
cure: Treat with antibiotics like oxytetracycline or potassium permanganate. Maintain optimal water conditions.

name: Tilapia Lake Virus
cause: Virus (Tilapia Lake Virus). Primarily transmitted through contaminated water or infected fish.
cure: No known cure. Prevention includes improving water quality, avoiding overcrowding, and using virus-free fish stocks.

name: Motile Aeromonad Septicemia
cause: Bacterium Aeromonas hydrophila. Can be transmitted through water and often occurs under poor water conditions.
cure: Administer antibiotics such as oxytetracycline. Improve water quality and avoid stress in fish.

name: Normal Nile Tilapia
cause: No disease present. This refers to healthy Nile tilapia with no signs of infection or illness.
cure: Maintain good cultural practices, proper water quality, and regular health monitoring.

name: Aeromonas Infection
cause: Bacterium Aeromonas species. Commonly found in warm waters, can infect through open wounds or poor water quality.
cure: Administer antibiotics like oxytetracycline. Improve water quality and ensure proper fish handling.

name: Sehat
cause: No disease present. 'Sehat' indicates the fish are healthy.
cure: Maintain good management practices and ensure proper water and feeding conditions for optimal health.

name: White Spot (WS)
cause: Parasite Ichthyophthirius multifiliis. A protozoan that infects fish, leading to white cysts on the skin and fins.
cure: Treat with formalin, copper sulfate, or malachite green. Maintain proper water temperature and quality.
